lines.text: Well, I'm savin' a life, that's all I know.
Maybe, but you don't make any sense at all! Which is all right, because if you're too drunk to talk, we'll find something else to do.
That's perfect. You even sound like a wife!
I do not consider that a compliment!
anti-wife! Any woman who devotes herself to making one man miserable instead of a lot of men happy don't get my vote.
George, a wonderful thing about Alaska is that matrimony hasn't hit up here yet. Let's keep it a free country!
Ahh, women! I never met one yet that was half as reliable as a horse!
Women. Peculiar.

[George is carrying three fresh bottles of champagne to Jenny's cabin]
Now see what you did?

[sarcasticly]
Well what did I did?
You have Michelle so confused that she don't know what she's doing, and now George is over there with my girl!

[disgusted]
Ohhhhhh!
This is my old friend Lena Nordquist.
How do you do, Mrs Nordquist?
Well, come on, come on! There's nothing to fear. She's half-human.

[Sam enters the cabin and picks up his revolver belt]
Is he that mad?
He's not even here! Over at another mine, fighting some claim-jumpers. One good thing about that, them shootin' at him will take George's mind off Jenny.
Yes. A bullet through the head is always the best cure for love.
Are you going to leave me here alone?
Make yourself at home. Billy's here.
Who's Billy?
George's little kid brother.
How little?
Seventeen. But he's man enough to take care of you!
That's what I'm afraid of!

[sniffing Michelle's neck after she seats her at the table]
Oh, golly, you smell good!
Thank you. Whatever you're cooking smells good, too.
I'd rather smell you.
Uhm... Shall we dine?
Sam?
Yes, Billy?
How do you feel when you're jealous?
Well, how should I know?
Well, I'm jealous!
Oh, where's that whiskey?
Sam, do you think George is keeping her over there, you know, against her will?
Oh, sure! You can hear her screamin' for help, can't ya?
Gosh, I just don't understand Michelle...

There's one thing you gotta learn about women. They're all liars. And if they ain't liars, they're worse, laying for you with wedding music. Take that little dame from Oregon. All I was doing was tying her shoe laces and she starts beating me over the head with a preacher. Or that little thing from Minnesota, who tried to marry me while I was so drunk I didn't know what I was doing, if it hadn't been for the parson's mercy, I'd have been hooked good, for good! You just can't trust women. No matter how honest they act, they all want to be wives!

[to Sam]
You're a pig-headed no-good and you always were.

[to Michelle after being punched by Sam]
Boy, does he love you!
